Reviews.Title: “misleading sleeping arrangements”
Reviews.Author: Vhaire S
Reviews.Content: Room was not suitable for three adults. Advertised as two singles and one bunk bed. It was one single and one bunk bed and we were unable to sit upright on the bottom bunk without hitting our head. Top bunk was very small with a thin hard mattress, only suitable for a child. Only one thin blanket on top bunk and we had to ask twice before we got another one. We stayed for three days and during that time only the single beds were made up, never the bunk bed and the room was never cleaned once On the plus side the breakfast was good with proper plates and cutlery. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Johnb2054
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel. Stay away from this place. There's about 30 hotels within a 2km radius of this hole that you could stay which are cleaner and just as cheap.

Reviews.Title: “big deal...”
Reviews.Author: Elwey
Reviews.Content: i was afraid about all bad reviews, but my surprise was find a clean, good location hotel, not too much confort, but if you we'll be outside all day and just need a good place for to sleep this is perfect for you, if you're a big person, is not for you, if you want to save money, this is a big deal, but don't expect too much for a few bucks

Reviews.Title: “small tiny shabby”
Reviews.Author: microdotty
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that we have every stayed at. The room was tiny, there was no cupboard. They say that the rooms are modern, lcd tvs....There was no chair or room for your luggage. Beds were hard, pillows were hard like melted plastic. Blanket was frayed, so bad not worth anything avoid it .

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was o.k. better than we thaught”
Reviews.Author: Carmelina S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights , great location, walking distance to major attractions, metro station not far from the hotel, taxis always available and breakfast included was perfect for us. Good value hotel for family. Clean, quiet, furniture is old but in good condition, wireless connection was good and beds are O.K. Parking garage was also great to have. The rooms need a facelift, carpet shoud be removed but over all a great stay. Service & staff are very helpful, polite & pleasant always eager to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was O.K. better than we had expected”
Reviews.Author: Maureen K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for a concert & meetings, great location, walking distance to major attractions, metro station, taxis always available and breakfast included was perfect for us. Although it's not a resort it's a good quality lodging, good value hotel for family travel for visiting or meetings. Clean, quiet rooms a little small, furniture is old but in good condition, wireless connection was good and beds are O.K. Parking garage was also nice to have. The rooms need a facelift, carpet shoud be removed but over all a great stay. Service & staff are very helpful, polite & pleasant always eager to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Two reasons not to stay at the same hotel twice”
Reviews.Author: thor_74HH
Reviews.Content: To make one statement clear: The hotel is average and meets the expected standard. In terms of cleanliness there is nothing to criticise. The location is great, walking distance to Vieux-MontrÃ©al and rue Ste. Catherine with downtown MontrÃ©al. However, I have stayed at this hotel on a previous visit to MontrÃ©al and altough I paid less, my room was larger and more comfortable. I booked an online rate, two twin beds, but was quite disappointed with the size of the room. As I said, I have stayed here earlier booking a similar room, that at least in my memory appeard larger. At least the bed. With a width of 100cm, calling it a "twin" is really more of a French style twin... The beds were not comfortable and the pillows even worse for my taste. Additionally, on my arrival the hotel garage was full, so I had to park my car at another garage. Even though I knew parking would be charged extra, had the hotel website stated more clearly, that the garage might not be available, I would have made different travel arrangements (either chosing a different hotel or returning the rental car earlier instead). That is very inconvenient and a reason for me, not to return to this hotel. The door to my room did not open properly and required a lot of force. I reported this to the front desk twice and they sent someone twice. Still, the door was not fixed properly. Breakfast was included in my rate. Overall, if you are strong enough to open rough-running doors, you have a good location at a resonable price. Personallly, I will look for a different hotel on my next stay after the experiences described above.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucas B
Reviews.Content: Tiny room. Bad service. Terrible bed and pillows. After the check in, we received a dirty and mess room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for 7 nights”
Reviews.Author: Martin K
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after a 7-night stay here. I found the hotel to be fine. Sure, the room was pretty tiny, 2 single beds, small shower/toilet, but clean, functional and very quiet. Would be a bit crowded with two in the room but perfectly comfortable for one. I was only there for the late evenings, with a conference during the day. The free wifi was reliable and efficient (and I was on 6th floor). Could use audio skype (didn't try video) and other apps easily. Breakfast was adequate too with toast, basic cereals, tea coffee juice and pastries. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful, so I would definitely recommend this as a good value hotel which has made a big effort to lift its game, as some of the comments in previous reviews have clearly been addressed.

Reviews.Title: “poor wireless connection”
Reviews.Author: ioplkj
Reviews.Content: There is something wrong with their wireless connection. For some reason I could browse but I could not access any email - gmail, hotmail, work email. I called front desk and the guy was absolutely useless. He kept on telling me they did not manage the network without offering any help. He could not even let me finish any of my sentences and hang up on me. I should have gotten his name and filed a complaint about his rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise: Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: mcprises
Reviews.Content: Read reviews after I booked and expected the worst. Pleasantly surprised: room was clean, neat, carpet good, staff pleasant. What's true: teeny tiny shower, room small, furnishings of low quality but clean and in good condition. Good motel in area surrounded by more luxurious places. Price good, location excellent. Didn't hear other rooms, room was serviced every day. Rated average because it is a very good motel quality, not a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of a University Dorm Room”
Reviews.Author: DivineMarquis
Reviews.Content: The rooms are definitely small. But considering all I did was sleep there overnight, it did the job. Well located, close to old Montreal and metro stations. There are better hotels in the area, but for a higher price. Once again this was alright for an overnight visit. I had no major problems.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: NfldTravellers
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel because we had to leave what we originally booked (hope you never stay there!). This place is pretty basic but the price is good for what you get - free WiFi (I had no trouble with it), reasonable room amenities (coffee, TV, alarm clock), clean bathroom. Compared to what we had left, this place was a 5 star. Mixed review on the desk service - one clerk was great but the other one was surly. Parking was a few blocks away but no big deal. Good location. OK place for a budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “"complete garbage!"”
Reviews.Author: Qjet
Reviews.Content: Everything these people are saying about this hotel is Correct. I just left it today. The rooms are too small and old looking. The counter is pathetic. They ran out of space in their own in door parking. They didn't even give us wash rags and we had to ask for it. The hallways upstairs looked like a run down physic ward. The wifi that they tell you about doesn't even reach the rooms properly. There where stains everywhere on the floor. I wish I checked trip advisor before going here. Waste of money. Your better off camping on Montreal city street. At least the homeless will have better service then this dump.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, and sometimes less”
Reviews.Author: madenjojo
Reviews.Content: Really basic room. Stained carpet. Minuscule bathroom. Insufficient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we stayed in on our trip”
Reviews.Author: Pinhead22886
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister on a trip to North America in winter 2010/11. Each place we visited we stayed in hotels in a similar price range to this one, but this was BY FAR the worst experience we had. The room was what you might expect in a dodgey hostel. "European style" seems to be code for run down and crappy. The beds were uncomfortable, and the carpet was old and dirty. Despite being a non-smoking room, the heater in the bathroom was giving out air that smelled like cigarette smoke, so we're just that one step closer to lung cancer, which is lovely. The worst thing about our stay was the noise. The paper thin walls meant we could hear everything from the adjacent rooms, and every time someone opened the door of another room on our floor, our door would also make a loud banging sound. I found it very hard to sleep, even with ear plugs in. I was so glad we only had two nights in Montreal. The ONLY (arguably) redeeming features of this place were the location close to Chinatown and a short walk to Old Montreal, and the breakfast, which was really quite good. Overall, avoid like the plague. You'd be better off staying in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair place to stay”
Reviews.Author: remobor1
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights in this hotel. It is well suited for people who don't look for exceptional comfort and look for a place to stay in downtown Montreal for a reasonable price. The hotel was a little below in terms of our cleaningness rexpectations, but overall it was acceptable. The underground parking is very valuable in a crowded city as Montreal. We would suggest such hotel only is you are seeking for an acceptable place to stay for a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this nightmare on Blvd Rene Lebesque”
Reviews.Author: mavanhall
Reviews.Content: We agree with the other recent reviews about this hotel. Everything is old, most of the staff are incompetent, the sheets on our bed were used, we got an offer for another room where the sheets weren't clean also, there were only two separate beds (which isn't nice for a second honeymoon). The third room (with two separate beds) had clean sheets which were so old you could see through them. There was no place in the parking, and also not in the next parking, and the costs of parking five blocks away are high. We look forward to our conversation with the manager tomorrow morning.....

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “oh boy!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNYC_5
Reviews.Content: We were on a group tour so this hotel was chosen by the travel agency and we got the dis-pleasure of staying there. Hotel Room felt like a hostel. We had two twin beds and with no room to move around. The shower was 2'x2', it was a bit small for my taste and I can't even imagine someone larger using it comfortably. Our bus driver actually jokingly said that he had to wash one shoulder at a time :) joking aside, this was the cheapest looking room with flooring material that we couldn't even figure out what it was. The cover on the bed was disgustingly old as well as the hard mattresses. In addition to that, the most upsetting to me was the front desk service. First, our sheets looked like they were used and when we told them they didn't seem surprised and did offer to switch rooms which we refused and just asked to bring us sheets and we changed the bed ourselves. The room key always got deactivated, and when we told them that we didn't have the key next to our credit cards their answer was "its for your security that the key gets deactivated in case someone finds it on the street!" just ridiculous if you ask me. The good thing was that it did include a breakfast and that the lobby was decent since I had to use the wi-fi there because in the closet sized room it of course didn't work. The best part is that it's a short walk to the old part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - what a difference 2 years can make!”
Reviews.Author: fruchick
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here in July of 2009, and like another guest below, found the hotel perfectly acceptable, clean, and a decent value for the price. Had some problems, but was able to deal. Fastforward to now. It's dirty. It's been poorly-maintained. And we've had nothing but problems. I'm sharing a 2-twin bedroom with a colleague. It's a tight fit, which might be tolerable if we could actually get some HOUSEKEEPING. We returned to our room after the first night, to find that they hadn't bothered coming around. At first I assumed this was a mix up due to our room change (they initially put us on the 3rd floor, where you inexplicably can't get the hotel's wifi signal). I was able to get clean towels and soap from the front desk, but it was too late in the day to receive a proper cleaning. But alas, TWO days in a row now, we have failed to receive housekeeping. I left the room over the noonhour, and the maid was working on the room next to ours. She saw me walk out, and remove the "do not disturb" sign from the door. Logic would dictate that she'd then clean our room. Nope! When I called down to complain upon my return, I was told that it's POLICY to not do this. When the housekeeping staff passes by a door with a do not disturb sign, their policy is to bypass it and NOT return. Are you kidding me? The beds are all undone, the remaining coffee in the pot from day one is threatening to develop self-awareness, and the shower - which drips incontrollably and splashes onto the bathroom floor - has created an en suite waterpark. Not the type of amenity I was looking for. I received a call back from the front desk, offering to send someone up to empty the now-overflowing garbage can (we've been living on take-out food), and leave us new towels. I accepted the offer, but it never happened. Also, I seem to remember the continental breakfast not sucking so bad back then. You have your choice of carbs, carbs, carbs, and maybe a sad-looking slice of watermelon if you're fast enough. The kicker? I paid more than double what I paid for the room 2 years ago. Giving 1/5 because at least there aren't any bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Looks old”
Reviews.Author: Choco_robba
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for Canada Day weekend. We had a twon room but it was so small, the room looked like it was a single room and then they decided to add another bed in there. After flushing the toilet, you have to wait or you will get extremely hot water at the sink. The good thinks about the hotel room is the air conditioner and there is free wifi just have to ask the desk for the password. There is a parking garage but it was full. So we had to go to another garage as the overflow parking was also full. The location is very good. Within walking distance to the metro, next to Chinatown and walking distance to Old Montreal. The breakfast that is free is croissants, cereal and bread. Bacon and eggs is extra. Like buying a breakfast. If anyone is just looking a place to sleep and don't really care about where they sleep, I would recommend this hotel. It is a bit pricy for what you get but i guess you are paying for location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: keevan66
Reviews.Content: Although the Location was good the hotel was not.No on site parking,Front desk staff not very friendly or helpful although they were courteous.There were 2 of us and the room was so small we could barely get our luggage in.Bathroom shower was both dirty and leaking.It looks like they've cut all the rooms in 1/2.Not 1oom in the hotel containing 2 queen sized beds. I've stayed at several Travelodge Hotels and all offer the same basic type of room.This was way off that mark.DO NOT STAY HERE.We moved the next morning and found a nice boutique hotel priced similiar.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two hotels”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrekkerNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first stayed at this property in March 2009. During this stay, we found the room to be small ("European-style rooms" always are), but clean and well-maintained. We returned in July 2011 and had a VERY different experience. The bedding was old, pillows terrible, carpet filthy, bathrooms fixtures old and worn, cobwebs abounded, and, well, you get the idea. I have to wonder if part of this hotel was renovated prior to 2009 and then they never bothered to do the rest. As we were last there during Jazz Fest, the rates were quite high for such a dirty, worn out room. I love this location and find the staff to be quite friendly, but, after our last experience, we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable”
Reviews.Author: TracyOOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cheap and allowed us to bring our dog, thats why we booked it. We were in montreal for only one night and we were going to an after hours club, so we wanted to book a hotel that was basically for a nap and a place to shower and go. It was a terrible stay. There was a stain that looked like blood on the comforter. The sheets were scratchy. There was not hot water at night when I wanted to shower and get ready. The room was tiny. Wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: nijoto
Reviews.Content: Wow, really glad I found this place, almost hate to write a good review because I fear I won't be able to book a room when I come back with the family. First time to Montreal and really fell in love with the city. Staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and very friendly. They bent over backwards to help me book an extra night when my trip got extended. Onsite parking was a huge plus, rooms were very clean. No street noise, I had a great view, and great nights sleep. A great value in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: countingpulses
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a friend's wedding, and she had arranged the hotel for her out of town guests at this location. It was easy to find and not a very long walk from the train station. I had just gotten off the phone with my friend and she said there would be a room key waiting for me at the front desk. I went up to the front desk and told them my name but they said there wasn't a room key that was left for me. There were two employees both female, but not one of them even pretended to look! I was very disappointed at this kind of attitude. I spelt my first and last name to them several times, still nothing. I ended up paying only for one night and left promptly the next morning. I arrived home (Toronto) and I found a reply from my friend regarding the hotel. They had indeed paid for a room for me for 2 nights, in room 304. I wouldn't recommend staying here, because the staff were cold and not even willing to put an effort in! I even gave them the name of my friend and her husband, but they blatantly said that there was nobody by that name that had paid for accomodations. I've stayed at hostels in Europe that had much better service than this "hotel."

Reviews.Title: “A very bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lons
Reviews.Content: We arrived in torrential rain and discovered it was the Grand Priz weekend, so the first shock was that they had whacked up their prices because of this. The staff were apologetic as they added the carpark was full too. The location of this hotel is excellent but even that wouldn't persuade me to stay again. The rooms are so small, the decor old and grim, it was not clean (don't look under the beds if you stay here!) and even worse- the shower would not work. The process of working out there was a major problem became a farce and involved a handyman coming up to the room and telling me I had to turn the temperature gauge to make it work. I had been doing this for 10 minutes and could only get boiling hot or stone cold. After a further 10 minutes, he finally admitted it was dangerous and I shouldn't use it. I then traipsed down to reception to ask if I could use the shower in another room. That too had an identical problem. I then tried a third but as I turned away from reception, I realised another guest was complaining about his shower. Of course the third room had the same problem. At this point I gave up and got dressed. Half an hour later my husband tried and this time it worked, so someone had obviously finally reset some major switch and got it working again. We checked out as soon as possible, having paid a massive sum to sleep in a tiny bed in a dirty room- with me still unshowered. I was so glad to leave. I didn't find the staff over friendly, although I remained courteous despite my frustration throughout. They were functional, dispensing different room keys for my attempted shower without success. It made me wonder if they had been through this before, although I didn't check if his was the case. We would never return. Ironically, we had chosen a Travelodge as we had a great experience the night before at the Trenton Travelodge, it was wonderful. It just shows how inconsistent a chain can be!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier with the Hotel and the General Manager”
Reviews.Author: Pete_E_of_SA
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Montreal, the hotel is very clean and well maintained. The rooms are nice and well organized. Very close to all the attractions we wanted to be close to. Don't even get me started on the staff...great people, everyone is very willing to help even if they are no longer "on the clock". Massimo the General Manager is a great person, a "get things done" kinda guy, can't say enough good things about him! Our experience at this fine establishment was definitely deserving of my rating (if there were six stars I would click again). This travelodge offered us the best value for our money, many other places were priced well above them.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: azikhanoom
Reviews.Content: worst hotel we have ever been. needs renovation badly. not clean and the room smelled very bad. bedding worn out and smelly. window very dirty. bathroom tilesif not full of mold, looked very dirty. breakfast service very bad and we had to search through cups to find one clean cup. Parking lobby smells really bad ..poor visibility throughout parking. Only 30 parking spots for the whole hotel area as the rest is given to Enterprise. Enterprise personnel also jam the parking entrance and their irresponsible attitude adds to all the problems in the parking area. Hall ways have not been vacuumed for ages. Toilet should be flushed more than once to clear out,................. Cheap hotel I know, but who gave them the 3 star status?! this is not worth one star. If I hadnot paid fully (through expedia website) for the whole stay I would have left right away.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price and location, and...”
Reviews.Author: NimsM
Reviews.Content: ...that's pretty much it. If room size and facilities are important, this isn't the place for you. It's very basic. The shower gets special mention. I'm 5' 2", and it was a tight fit. This is my first time at a Travelodge, so I'm not sure if this is what you get at other properties. As far as this particular one is concerned, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, very cozy!”
Reviews.Author: PattiDallas_Tx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group and it meet our needs. The front desk was helpful and always polite. The rooms are pretty small along with the bathrooms! But we really did not stay in the room very much! I did find the rooms, hallway and lobby very clean.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING DEAL”
Reviews.Author: r_sey
Reviews.Content: the location was a perfect spot for walking distance to nightclubs, restaurants and malls. we went from two twins and a "bunk bed" room to a one queen and sofa bed suite that has an amazing bathroom and a fully equipped kitchen. We did get some bad advice from other people at first but thanks to the sweetest receptionist Tanya and SPECIAL THANKS to the general manager Massimo Urzillo for changing our minds about those negative comments. Overall, we had an amazing time in and out of our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 19,2011”
Reviews.Author: Yvonnechick
Reviews.Content: Feb 19,2011. As we left I wanted to write this review/HORRIBLE place.We got there and there was NO parking and the parking lot they sent us to was full. We got to our room and everything looked good until we saw a bug didn't think anything of it until we saw one on our bed and then on the outlet.googled an image and it was a BEDBUG!!!! called front desk they sent someone up and it was confirmed it was a bed bug. We did not get an apology and I had asked if they had them before and I was told not this year and was offered another room. We left and found another Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nicely situated and great people.”
Reviews.Author: W0rldtravelbuff
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Travelodge for a few days and I was greeted warmly form a girl named Tania which was helpful with the check in. THe front desk staff helps when needed but also in the resturant the are more than welcoming. The rooms are small but you do notice that they have done renovations within the last years. The showers are small but they do the job. For a bigger person it would be hard to enjoy a shower. The breakfast was included and of course it is contiental breakfast but it suffices. They offer different things such as croissants,chocolate croissants, cereals,jams, peanut butter, cinnamon rolls, yogurt and other things. They also offer the option of having american breakfast at an extra cost. Roberto one of the owners of the rest aurant was extremely helpful and friendly. He helped me find my way around montreal. I would definately recommend this hotel although don't expect luxury it is more of a convient hotel that is well situated without busting you budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms Uncomfortable Beds Stinky Shower and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: garytalky01
Reviews.Content: Stayed win this crappy hotel with my 18 year old son and 2 of his friends. The boys complained of how small the room was and how uncomfortable the bunk bed were. The shower was weak and I even found a dirty spot on my bed sheet. I myself went to the breakfast and everything seemed dried. We did not stay another night because I was fed up with how the boys reacted and not satisfied because their upgraded room a suite was small also. I was too late to get my money back and I really didn't want to drive back to Long Island NY at night due to the heavy snow and pitch black darkness for 7 hours. I ended up not driving all the way and ended up in the Mariott By the way it cost me 17 per night to park my car in their small indoor garage.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fine and you can't beat the location...”
Reviews.Author: whileitravel
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. My room was located on the top floor and while it is on the small size, it was fine by me. Flat screen TV and free wifi are most of the amenities I need. Both the room and bathroom were clean. Breakfast consist of a continental breakfast, but it beats Days Inn across the streets which charges $9.50 for their breakfast. The hotel lacks a business centre, but the front desk staff were very helpful when I needed a document printed and faxed. The prime location is it's selling point. Checking out was painless and quick. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved the location and the price.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDog
Reviews.Content: althoug travelodge is usually more a motel than a hotel, it was a comfortable city hotel, what we really liked very much. Room was simple but cosy bed and we slept good there. it is located right in the downtown and it was just a few steps away from ol Montreal and the things to see. They had good Breakfast and good Restaurant WiFi was free and there was also a free newspaper!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lukino6
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived to Montreal from Toronto on a night bus connection, I turned up at the hotel at 8 am, knowing that the official check-in time was at 3 pm and I expected to be told to come back later, but the gentleman at the reception was very nice and gave me a room rightaway. That really saved my day since I was able to get some extra sleep before exploring Montreal. I was given a room on the highest floor (level 11). It was relatively small but had everything I needed. Large bed, clean bathroom, flat screen TV. free wifi for which the pasword needs to be obtained from reception. There is a vending machine, and ice avaliable on the Mezanine floor. The breakfast was included in my rate, but it was just very basic, croissants, toast bread, peanut butter, jam, and juice. If I had stayed more than one night I would not have bothered to have the breakfast the following days. The hotel's location is great. Very near the St. Catherine's Street, Chinatown, and the old town. A Subway station and the coach station are also nearby. I would definitely stay again. PS: Even though Quebec is a french speaking place, the people also speak english, and won't get rude and mean just because one doesn't speak french. This is something the continental french should learn.

Reviews.Title: “This wasn't a $74 hotel, more like $24.”
Reviews.Author: 000sam
Reviews.Content: Room was really small and cramped. We arrived at around 2pm and were asked to wait for the room to be cleaned. After returning twice, up to 5pm, room still wasn't ready. No towels. 2 half-used complimentary shampoo bottles. Floor was dirty. Old guest's glasses still in room. Beds were hard (not firm, but hard). Pillows were, like one-inch thick. WiFi requires password from the front desk. Pay parking in building for an extra $20. We've stayed in Travelodges all around the world, and this was definitely the worst. On a side note, our floor was occupied mostly by drunk teenagers who screamed where the party was at from 12 midnight to 4am. It wasn't a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Il n'y avait aucun probleme.”
Reviews.Author: EA_South_Dakota
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, clean and convenient, no problem whatsoever. The room was small, to be sure, and it took some ingenuity to find a place for my suitcase--but hey, life is tough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: 1beachroamer
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Montreal from October 26-30. The hotel is located close to lots of inexpensive public transportation. The commute from the airport was $7 and that was for the bus #747 departing from the airport baggage claim area. That $7 included a 24hr public transportation pass which could be used on all the systems. The hotel room was a bit small and cramped. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast and internet. The internet was of particular importance and added to the overall value of the stay. This is not an expensive hotel so I did not expect expensive service. We slept really well and the place was quiet. All problems encoutered were properly and sufficiently solved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vitodelia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonally priced. It included breakfast. It had an excellent location. We love to walk, and the hotel was a short walk from old Montreal which we love. It was located very near China Town. We think overall, it was an excellent stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst rooms and staff!”
Reviews.Author: roy2k
Reviews.Content: I cant believe the SMALL size of the room and showers. i had to squeeze in the shower and the corridors had a bad odour, so did the elevator. The room service person yelled in our room and woke us up! dont ever make a mistake by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “If you're taller than 5'7" it's an adventure in itself!”
Reviews.Author: krazykritik
Reviews.Content: We purchased a stay at TL Montreal for 'charity' from Ebay. When we bought it, we were told it was for 5 nights, with all amenities and parking included by the company we bought it from. When we arrived on the Saturday(25th of Sept.), immediately we were told we'd have to pay for parking. After trying to explain that we had booked the stay weeks prior and were assured that parking was included in this 'charitable' purchase, my wife ended up having to spend 45 minutes explaining our case to Delphine who told her that we weren't even supposed to be inpossession of this package and that it had been given to a company for their use. Nevertheless, after almost an hour, the parking was deleted and my wife kept being asked who we bought it from. We didn't remember and were also pestered about it when we checked out at which time they "got us back" by charging us for the fridge, something we need due my medication and were also told was covered with the 'package' when my wife phoned to confirm a fridge was available. We just paid for it as we were tired of answering questions about where we got the package and who sold it and what was covered and what wasn't, but in my opinion, Travelodge owes me $50 for a fridge that had a poor seal and a freezer so packed with undefrosted ice that we couldn't put more than 2 popsicles in it. Having said that. The hotel's rooms are pathetically small, but what does one go to a hotel for? To sleep and shower. But the rooms are not made for anyone over 5'7" - 5' 9" as everything is in such close proximity that it's impossible to leave there without having your shins smashed on the solid wooden bedframe(that's right, no boxspring). The bathroom measures about 4 feet deep by 6 feet long and the shower is basically a basin with a curtain and two cheap plastics strips that do a poor job of keeping the water inside the shower. If this is "European Style" then I'm glad I don't travel to Europe very often, yet I haven't seen any European rooms as yet that match the puny outlay of these ones. It's a place to sleep and wash but that's it. The lobby has NOTHING except an overpriced souvenir shop and a few places to sit. They do provide free newspapers, but I had to go down from the top floor to get mine after being told they would be delivered to our door, which never happened once. On the first night(Sun. 26th), I woke up at 2 am(as I always do wherever I sleep) and decided to go downstairs for a walk. In the hallway, there was a man sleeping on the floor right by our room. I called the desk and reported it as I was afraid for my wife's well-being and the other guests. I was assured someone would be right up. I went downstairs and around 3:30 went back upstairs. The man was still there. I phoned the desk again and again was told it would be looked after. I fell asleep until 5:30 and woke up at which time I checked the hall again. The man was STILL there! So I woke him to see if he was ok. He was just a homeless fellow, but I told him he'd better get out before the cops got called, so I escorted him to the elevator and pushed the button for the bottom floor. I should have given him one of the hotel's blankets and pillows because an hour later I went to go down to go get coffees and he was sleeping in the elevator. So I(YES, ME) rode the elevator downstairs with him and led him out the front doors. Is this MY JOB? My wife and I and all the guests have the right to think that the hotel staff will do their jobs to see that we're safe when on their property and I confronted the front desk about this. Not the start to our 5 day vacation on our first trip to Montreal I was expecting. The staff was pretty nice overall, especially the Cuban fellow(forget his name) and other than the nitpicking about the parking and fridge, it was a friendly and helpful staff. **SUGGESTION: Change the carpet in the elevators for the love of God. It stinks like urine and mold in all the cars and is LONG OVERDUE for a change. At least steam them and put strong odor destroyer down because they smell that bad. The rest of the hotel is clean and the lady on the 11th floor cleaning staff was excellent and very friendly. **SUGGESTION: Either get some boxsprings or add sleep padding on the beds as by the time my 5 days were up, my hips and back were so sore I could barely walk. If you're there for 1 or 2 nights, it will suffice. For longer stays, go elsewhere. The pillows are flatter than pancakes and even 2 extra ones barely make one pillow. **Breakfast: It's your very basic "continental breakfast". **SUGGESTION: One kind of bagel, no healthy cereal choices such as granola or oats but they did have Cheerios along with fruit loops and rice krispies. The coffee is bitter and needs to be improved. And would it kill them to offer yogurt or waffles? Two kinds of muffins, same everyday. On the last morning we were there they provided bananas but they were gone so fast I just about had to wrestle with an angry frenchman who was trying to take the last three for himself. Overall, this place is good for a one or two night stopover, nothing more as there are no amenities worth mentioning. Not even so much as a television in the lobby for latenighters like myself who can't sleep. I have a very hard time recommending this place to anyone except for the fact that it wasn't nearly as bad as some of the reviews suggest and the staff was quite fine in their capacities, other than the pestering about how and where we got the rooms on Ebay. And the location to Old Montreal, the transit system, and many attractions is excellent. Like I said, don't plan anything long if this is your choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but a good location”
Reviews.Author: ThinController
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Montreal Centre website describes itself as a "European style" hotel, which is a good description - it certainly has the "feel" of continental hotels I have stayed in. The location on the edge of Chinatown is very goods - lots of Chinese restaurants within easy walking distance, and public transport was very good. The rooms are small (like a European hotel) and while generally clean the hotel is looking somewhat aged with stains and wear on the carpet in both the hall and rooms. Beds were clean and comfortable but when servicing the room the hotel had missed some plastic rubbish from prvious patrons. There are three lifts, and during the morning breakfast period there could be quite a wait. Irons and ironing boards are not provided in the rooms but are available from the check in desk. A complimentary continental style breakfast is included in the room price. The website describes this as a "deluxe" continental buffet breakfast, but it is limited to cereal, bread items (croissants, bagels, muffins and toast) and fruit - several European hotels I have stayed in have offered cheese, ham and sometimes eggs as well as the bread items, so for a "deluxe" breakfast was expecting a little more. There is a gift shop near the lobby selling a good range of souvenirs and stamps, and vending machines on the Mezzaine floor. Complimentary newspapers are available from the lobby. The hotel was very busy all three days, but front desk staff seemed to handle guests efficiently. I booked through a conference and so received good value for money for downtown Montreal ($129 per night plus tax).. Would stay here again. TC

Reviews.Title: “its ok good location”
Reviews.Author: smittyto
Reviews.Content: Went to Montreal for f1. The room was definitely small and the bathroom was blocked up but someone came within 20 minutes to fix the problem. Had zero issues with service the staff was actually good. The breakfast was ordinary but you can pay for something better. I recommend this hotel for short stays and trips when your not in the room for anything else but sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest mistake in my Life -Chosing this dirty place”
Reviews.Author: Krish72
Reviews.Content: I'm and Engineer from Ottawa.I booked this hotel through Otel.com website. Travelled with wife an 2 kids, we reached 20 minutes earlier. Parked my car in hotel's temporary parking. Left my family in car, I went to reception. The lady at reception treated me like I'm in front of her to beg some job or money. She was so arrogant, rude and behaved like I made a punishable mistake by reaching 20 minutes earlier. She did not allow me to park my car in temporary parking. Her actions were 1. Did not attend me for 5-7 minutes, acted like she is so busy (She was not serving any other customers) 2. She did not allow me to park my car in temporary parking for another 20 minutes till I check in (My kids wee so tired after journey) 3. She said no space can be given in hotel parking. Also, did not guide me if any parking available nearby 4. To me she was so aggressive. But to the customer next to me, she was so nice and pleasing. " Is there any discrimination to people from some part of the world? or any importance in skin color?" I complaind to the supervisor. She was better than this lady. While I was talking to this supervisor, she spoke to another girl in a threatening voice about me. By hearing this I told the supervisor that I'm withdrawing my complaints. I didn't have any option. I was afraid, she may do some thing against us during our stay there. About the room, it was a small cattle shed. No internet and no connection to outside in this advanced world of technology. The supervisor told me that this is European style. I lived in many hotels in different countries. Amercas, Europe, Asia, Middle east.... Never seen this kind of room. For all reviews, the management is giving a very good explanation. If you visit the hotel website, you can watch beautiful pictures of luxury rooms. This may be from a different hotel or otherwise the Manager's room itself. Carpets were so dirty, smells like decayed fish / meat, stained. Washroom is sooo small. The shower curtain will always touch your body. Providing only 2 towels for 4 of us. Pillows and blankets are itchy. Also, very noisy. You may feel like you are sleeping in corridor. Sleeping in my car will be more comfortable. I spent CA$ 24.00 for 24 hours parking in a nearby parking lot. I doubt this hotel is approved by any government agencies. They are claiming that this is European standard. Shame.!! Don't use the name of Europeans and its systems for this cheating business. I never seen any hotel of this kind any where in europe. Breakfast was a joke. Lots of bread and strawberry jam. Better to bring your break fast with you. I doubt this hotel is misusing name of Travelodge group. I stayed a month before in Toronto Travelodge- Its so different. Please remove and replace some of your staff. The supervisor and the tall lean guy, both were good. But the girl whose name starts with 'S'- she is the one who troubled us. Canada never allows Racism. This is multicultural nation. People are living this country peacefully respecting ech other. I will neve recommend this hotel to any one , anywhere and any time in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location for the money”
Reviews.Author: Greg018
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. For the money, you can't go wrong. Sure, it's not the fanciest hotel and the rooms are a little smaller than some other places, but it is clean and air conditioned and extremely reasonably priced for downtown Montreal. We were on a group culinary tour of Montreal, and it was an excellent location for our tour, close to the train station, metro, Chinatown, and the Old Port. The staff was very helpful. This is a great place too for groups that are travelling because the hotel has triple and quad rooms that can accommodate up to 3 or 4 people in a room. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: dora_explor
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Rooms were very small(our cases hardly fitted), Rooms were smelly carpet was dirty, as was the bedspread, pillow and bed terrible. If you want a good night sleep this is not the place! Staff unhelpful and unfriendly. Breakfast ordinary. They should have paid me to stay there, not the other way around.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Barrachibabe
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry but we found the hotel to be poorly lacking. The rooms were tiny, the carpets stained and the bed spreads old and worn. There was hair in my bed, two towels for four of us. We had to ask the evening staff 3 times for extra towels. They were very unhelpful and seemed not to care. I must say the day staff were very helpful. The place needs a total update, I feel you should be warned how tiny the rooms are before handing over your money.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Paty1203
Reviews.Content: The front desk guy who checked us in was really rude and did not pay attention to his work. We arrived at 4:30 am in the morning and had already paid with an agent for 2 nights, however in the morning the hotel personnel was knocking at my door saying I had to leave or pay for the second night! I told them I had already paid for two nights and 10 minutes later they were calling saying the same thing! I had given the copy of the reservation to the guy who checked us in and told them to look into their records. Finally they confirmed I was right, but I didn't get an apology. Since I had arrived too early in the morning I left the hotel at around 1:30 pm to go around the city, not surprisingly the housekeeper never showed up, the room never was cleaned! The hotel is too expensive ($105 USD/night for a standar double bed room), the bathroom is tiny, the carpet in the room and in the aisles is really dirty! The garage is also very dirty. The aisles and the room smell as if it was allowed to smoke. I have paid $100 for a room the double size and really clean, with nice personnel, this hotel does not worth the price at all! Awful! Do not spend your money there. I saw some smaller hotels in Montreal downtown offering double bed rooms for $70, so check your possibilities. I feel like I was robbed and insulted. In Misissauga I paid $84 for a room with 2 double beds in the Best Western, it was clean and the personnel was kind and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “along with many other here, this goes to the top of my list as the worst hotel Ihave ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Canadian09876
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I have stayed in LOTS of hotels and hostels. LOTS. it doesn't take much to please me, really. I am not picky. This is one of the two or three times I have wanted to walk out and find a new hotel room. If time would have permitted, I would have. We were there for a show so we were pressed for time. the check in took 30 minutes and when we got the to the front the clerk ignored me when I asked twice about parking but when my husband finally asked she said they were all full. No parking. We had to go find parking in the city. Then we couldn't find our room and had to wait in line again to be told the room was RIGHT BESIDE THE RESTAURANT on the Mezzanine level. She smirked at us like she knew we were never going to find the room but didn't bother to tell us how to get there. Either that or she was smirking because she knew we had the worst room in the hotel. As soon as I saw we were one foot away from where the entire hotel would start tromping past at 7 am for their free breakfast, I called the front desk and begged for another room. She put me on hold for 10 minutes. I called back, she hung up on me. I called back she said there was a room with two single beds and when I said we would push them together she laughed at me. "No you won't it's too small." And we would have to pay for the larger room if we took the smaller one. Wow. What customer service. Yep, starting at 5 am, employees were screaming outside our door and it didn't stop until 11 am. Then our toilet backed up. And for all this we got to fork over $130! Amazing! NEVER. EVER. EVER. STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: brownie06
Reviews.Content: Okay, so its not the best place I've stayed at, infact the rooms were tiny and not very clean. But on the upside, its in a great location... Just minutes away from Norte-Dame, Old Montreal, China Town and while we were there.. the added plus of the Jazz festival!! If you are looking for a place that is affordable where you just want to spend the night at and is close to almost everything and the finest restaurants, this is your answer. They even provide a complimentary breakfast (which is okay if you are into cereal).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient value - Don't expect luxury at this price”
Reviews.Author: Al-from-Jax
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are very small, so if you're going to Montreal to stay in your room all day, this isn't the place for you. But the location is excellent, the staff is friendly and helpful, the WiFi is free, the continental breakfast is fair, and the price is one of the lowest in the area. My first reaction was along the lines of some of the other reviews, since the rooms are probably half the size of what we have become used to. If you're traveling with a lot of luggage, or with a family, you'll probably want to go somewhere else. But if you want a clean, reasonable hotel to be your base for enjoying Montreal, there really is nothing to complain about here. The free continental breakfast includes breads, cereal, fruit, and juice. You can order eggs or other additions as well. The room is big enough that we always found a table quite easily, but it is only open for breakfast. In summary, if you go in with high expectations for a low price, you're fooling yourself. This hotel is fine for those who just want a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel accommodations I've experienced in over 40 years!”
Reviews.Author: JJGOhio
Reviews.Content: The room was 2 single beds and was so small that the beds were arranged in an "L" along 2 walls. There was almost no room to store clothes. The bathroom was more like a "stall". We had more room on a river cruise boat. The location is fantastic, but the room was pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “BAD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: icippo82
Reviews.Content: Decidedly a bad choice!! Dirty,damp,and lacking of many elementary services Rooms are small and with no wardrobe. Beds are enough confortables as well as for the cushions. Breakfast really disappointing:milk,some cornflakes and some dry brioches a pour fruit selection and nothing more! For certainly i will not stay once again in Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: gordenS
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at the Travelodge it was close to many attractions, staff were very helpful. the rooms are small but it didn't matter to me cuz, I just go to sleep there, and save on my accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Just what you could ask for.”
Reviews.Author: soccerdude24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends for one night. The room was perfect for us; if you plan on spending a lot of time in your room, then you might think it to be small, but if you plan on being out and experiencing Montreal then there's no problem. Overall it was a very reasonable price for a nice hotel. There is parking too. Location was perfect, right in between the Old Montreal/Chinatown area and the McGill/ St Laurent area. The breakfast was standard fare but included in room price. I would recommend this hotel as a good value for a nice, clean, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Holetel”
Reviews.Author: Ackshun
Reviews.Content: Slow season, so we got a decent deal at $80. Lobby is nice and clean. Get to the room, the door hits the first single bed. Use the bathroom, that door hits the other single bed. Between the two beds, there was room for 2 people to stand up. Brutal. TV was from 1980, and had 30 channels to select from. The shower is awkward. You have to stand on a weird angle with the water spraying towards your right side or you will risk flooding the place. Vending machine took my money last night, and the dill pickle chips would not fall down. Told reception, he said "the gift shop owns that. come back in the morning, talk to 'em and you'll get your money back". Well uhhh that wasnt the point. it was my last toonie, but the lovely gentleman did offer to break my $20 so I could give it another shot. LOL $20 for parking. This place doesn't attract the finest clientele either. Just walking up my floor at 3am last night, the halls are filled with at least 4-5 pizza boxes, a ton of chinese takeout containers, garbage bags, and some noodles spread out in front of the elevator. I would definitely rather spend the extra $40-$60 to sleep somewhere with more comfortable pillows, or perhaps ones that do not tiny blood stain dots on the bedsheets. YUP. Blood on the sheets. In all, these rooms are way too small to charge for. In fact, I think I rather sleep in my car. The room cleaners were really nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Cindertown
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of the city,right next to Chinatown.All attractions within walking distance from here.Room was fairly small and basic but ample for our needs.Breakfast (continental + cereals and toast) included in price.Friendly reception staff,very helpful.Great Chinese restaurant around the corner,Dynasty.

Reviews.Title: “small room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Niepez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to Chinatown and St. Denis as well as the Old Town are still in walking distance. The complimentary breakfast offers a fair choice. The room was rather small and a little cobwebby.

Reviews.Title: “One step up from a student hostel”
Reviews.Author: smokedmeat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, September 5-6. Reserved one room at the nightly rate of $119 CAD. I booked my room on the hotel's website. A few days later, I got a call from the manager as he had noticed I was one person staying in a room with a single and a bunk bed. (It was the cheapest room available.) He offered to switch me to a room with two single beds at the same rate, and I was fine with that. At check-in, I asked if there was any space in their parking garage for my car, and there wasn't. Instead, I parked underground across the street at the Complexe Guy-Favreau (entrance on Rue St-Urbain), a federal government building, for $16/day. I got to my room (518) and was ready for the worst after seeing other reviews and photos. Sure enough, I got a small room with two single beds (not side-by-side, but in an L-formation), a small desk and a flat screen TV mounted on the wall. All bedding and draperies seemed dated. Also, there was no closet but simply a small rack with hangers near the window. As for the bathroom, it was as small as advertised. There was barely any room near the toilet seat, and the sink didn't have a plunger (working or otherwise). As for the shower, it reminded me of a phone booth. It measures about 3' by 3' in a pentagon shape, and anyone tall would have difficulty getting clean. The one positive thing about the hotel was the complimentary continental breakfast offered every morning. It is served in a large dining area on the mezzanine level, and the food selection is quite enormous. I stuck with fruit and yogurt, but there were several types of pastries, cereal, boiled eggs, coffee and juices available. I chose the hotel because my first choice (the Holiday Inn Select) was sold out. The Travelodge is just around the corner from Chinatown, which was the main reason for my stay. It was also convenient to have an IGA supermarket across the street (corner of RenÃ©-Levesque and St-Urbain, inside the Complexe Desjardins). A few blocks south is the Notre-Dame Basilica and Old Montreal. This hotel was the first Travelodge to be opened in North America and sadly, it has not aged well. If I had to visit Montreal again and needed to stay in the area, this would be my last choice. I can only recommend it as a last resort if there are no better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and parking”
Reviews.Author: swanbrook
Reviews.Content: The room my husband and I stayed in was no bigger than a closet I was very disappointed we could barley get out suitcases in there was no tub just shower and we were not even given the option. I am also disappointed in the fact that you have to pay to park at the hotel your staying at when your already paying for the room I was not impressed I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elvedina
Reviews.Content: Except the location, there is nothing else you can find in this hotel. The room was super tiny; You almost hit your head from the TV hanging next to the door when you enter the room. I understand that the room is just for sleeping but the money you pay should give you a little more. Plus, I don't appreciate not having a fridge in the room and some big towels when you take a shower. =>Don't forget to bring your own towels in case you want to have a shower because you need at least 2 or 3 from their big towels.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst not the best...”
Reviews.Author: MandaD
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night because while its cheap its not really value for money. We had tiny twin beds squished into the strangest shape room and it was a bit grubby. The location was good though. Breakfast was alright.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID FOR YOUR OWN SAKE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1234567890On
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel in room 1022 a couple weekends ago. I could not wait to find this to WARN OTHERS TO NOT STAY HERE. I got there at about 5 pm and checked in... i was exhausted from traveling from sault ste. marie ON and as i layed on the bed there was black hairs all over the place ( i am a brunette) so I went down and asked that they change the bedding and they took 2 hours!!!! i couldn't believe it, i have never experienced anything so awful. The rooms were incredibly tiny and we could hardly shower together it was a tiny stand up and i am 120 pound and he is 160, fit people, it was incredibly ridiculous. the tv hardly worked, like we cared much at that point. if you think of your bedroom at home, cut that in half and that is the whole room (including the bathroom, i read the reviews but i didn't understand it was that bad) Needless to say it is close to great shopping and we had a great time otherwise... but i would NEVER stay here again, not worth 40 a night. if you get it cheaper, go for it! if not... keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy...Lived Up To Its Billing”
Reviews.Author: KupunaAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Travelodge--a branding generally synonymous with the basics of accommodation. So it was with this property, well situated as the colourful Boul. Saint Laurent stretches into 'le quartier chinois' at Rene-Levesque. Staff was responsive and courteous, complying with my request for an upper-floor, quiet room. Was glad I am not a person of exceptional size, for my room was noticeably diminutive--but clean except for the observance (and removal) of previous guests' hair on the quilt. Happened to stay at a time of deep-freeze/Siberia-type cold, but the heating systems worked fine. On my top floor, I observed major ceiling leakage near the elevators--this was repaired and cleaned up the next day. Gift shop did not stick to its posted hours, not even opening at all one day. Mezzanine restaurant, coming to life only during the hours (0700-1030) for the complimentary continental breakfast, was nicely appointed and essential food items re-stocked when appropriate. Tip: kitty-corner across Rene-Levesque by Saint-Urbain, was the Complexe Desjardins, a super shopping arcade with over a hundred shops including some eating-spots worth checking out. And if your stay includes a visit to the U.S. Consulate, this facility is no more than a brisk 10-min walk away. Bus terminal can be accessed on foot in about 15 min...handy if you take the Aeroports de Montreal shuttle from/to Trudeau-Dorval Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: chris11xb
Reviews.Content: True, the room was 10ft x 10 ft and it took a contortionist to take a shower, but where else can you get a clean safe hotel with reasonable on-site parking right downtown in Montreal (or any major city) for less than $75/night. The room was tiny and subway-like, but that should only matter if you plan on spending all day in the hotel (and why would you do that in Montreal?). Its location is ideal - the hotel is located within Chinatown and the financial district, and squarely centered walking distance in the middle of everything -1 block to the downtown shopping district, easy walking distance to Old Town, the waterfront, and McGill University. We had business at the US Consulate, and found this hotel to be less than 3 blocks away. The hotel itself is newly renovated, the lobby is nice and the staff friendly. The rooms are cramped, but we needed nothing but a bed and that is what we got for a great price. My only complaint is with the showers that are so small I could barely fit in them, and the shower head is locked in place in a useless direction.

Reviews.Title: “terrible submarine simulation, a submarine of 100 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: Boston099
Reviews.Content: I waited for about a month to write my review because I thought some cooling-off period might be necessary to provide fair comments. I stayed at Travelodge hotel from September 10-15 for a scientific meeting that was held at the Convention center, about 3 minutes walk from the hotel. I had to select this hotel because there was no alternate available when I made last minute reservation through the society housing bureau. I was interested in the comment previously mde by someone that this hotel is for submarine simulation. I was not sure what submarine simulation actually meant. Did it mean that rooms are small and irregular in shape? dark, noisy and depressing? All was true. Most of all, I was amazed from the day 1 to see a lot of water flood in bathroom without bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! Absolutely.”
Reviews.Author: singer3891
Reviews.Content: The disappointment about the lousy, tiny room can only be exceeded by the upset toward the horrible "service". The room is ridiculously small. One of my friends was actually laughing when we checked in. Yes. It is RIDICULOUS! One step in the room to any direction, you will bang into something for sure. The next level of being tiny is the capsule hotel in Japan. On top of that, you have to deal with the receptionist that hardly ever smiles for something that are supposed to work in the room. I know I will stay away from any travelodge because of this traumatic experience. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: nivek53
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a great time up in Montreal for the weekend and even though we could have stayed at a better place, we probably couldn't have done it for much cheaper. Yes the room was small and the TV would loose reception randomly, but all we needed was a place to sleep off the night, clean up, and set off again. The hotel was located so that we hardly had to use the metro and I felt safe walking back in the early morning. The coffee was great, the muffins good, but everything else free for breakfast was as reviewed. We had no problem with the staff and the rooms were well kept. A couple of tips: the parking was full upon arrival, but there is a public underground deck right down the block on Rue Saint Urbain that was $2 less a day (the front desk has maps, just park in the taxi lane to check in first). Also, always ask for two city maps at the front desk; we gave our extra map to someone in need and she gave us two tickets to the NASCAR race right at the finish line in return. My only regret is that I ended up over bidding on Priceline to stay here. If you can strike a deal for less than what the Travelodge site states, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JElec
Reviews.Content: A small, dirty, cramped hotel that is definitely not worth the price of $125 (incl. parking). The beds are not comfortable, the layout of the room is awkward, the shower is probably 3 ft wide by 3 ft long with a poorly functional drain that collects a pool of water while you shower. If you want to shower for a long period of time, the water will overflow and flood the entire bathroom floor. The room I was in had 4 beds total, 2 of which were mounted on the wall. I felt like I was in a couchette train car in Europe. When the heater was turned on, it spewed out a smell as if something was burning. The AC did work well. All in all, I would not have stayed at that hotel if I knew about this website and read all the other poor reviews given.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Lousy”
Reviews.Author: petercs
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from this hotel. It was cheap and close to the convention center. I expected the room to be tiny and it was. Think a college dorm room and that's about right. I am typically a low-maintenance guy when it comes to hotels. I rarely ask the front desk for anything. However, the few times that I have had to deal with the front desk staff, the experience was terrible. The people they have at the front desk at night, in particular, are argumentative, unhelpful and tend to blame any problems on the guests. An example: there is no restaurant in the hotel (there is a continental breakfast, more on that later) and the neighborhood is not a place you want to roam at night. For your late night snack or soda cravings there are three vending machines (over-priced, but I expect that). Anyway, I asked the front desk staff to break a 5 dollar bill as the vending machines take only change. No luck. In fact, the guy at the desk offered to give me the 4 dollars in change he had in his pocket for my 5. Huh?! Oh, and I interrupted him having a long, loud argument with another guest who was fed up with the terrible service and trying to cancel the rest of his stay. So, he points me down the street and says there's a store at the corner that's open. I wasted half an hour looking for this place on the corner. Never found it. Another example: I needed to get some laundry sent out. I asked for a second laundry bag which the front desk staff gave me. When I came back down with my dirty laundry in two bags, they wanted me to re-sort it *in public*(!) in the lobby because it was apparently my fault there was only one laundry form in my room. They needed two - one for each bag. You'd think they would have thought of that when they gave me the 2nd bag. On top of that, they couldn't find any more forms at the front desk. They ended up taking my single form and photocopying it. The odd thing is that the front desk staff during the day seem quite nice and helpful. So, I'll echo what others have already mentioned. Yes, the continental breakfast is pathetic. Doughy croissants and fruit cocktail. Yuck! The shower will not stop dripping. The A/C in my room was marginal. It was usually warmer and more humid in my room than either outside or in the hallway. What was decent? Well, the wireless internet in the room worked fine for me. I liked the guy who ran the "souvenir shop" in the lobby (open only at bizarre and unpredictable hours, however). The day staff at the front desk were helpful in getting my shuttle back to the airport and in correcting a few minor maintenance issues (a bulb burned out, my telephone stopped working). The cleaning staff also were fine. I would gladly have paid more (significantly more) had there been another option for the conference I was attending. However, it was the only lodging offered through the official conference hotel broker that fit my dates. If I were to do it again, I would have made my own reservations separately with a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TINY room and a dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: AcuraF1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I drove to Montreal for the Jazz Festival (great time by the way), so I booked a room at this Travelodge a few weeks in advance - one room with two twin beds. We arrived and when I opened the door, Wow, there was a small desk on an angle a few inches clear of the open door. The room was small, approx. 10 feet by 10 feet - including the bathroom. Two twin (single) beds and the small desk. I commented to my friend that at least there was a flat screen TV, to which he replied "you couldn't fit a regular TV in this room" lol. The tiny shower stall (no tub) had mold on the tile grout and there was mold and hairs on the window sill - gross. If all you are looking for is a place to sleep, and you don't bring any luggage, or worry about your own personal hygiene, the Montreal Centre Travelodge is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Boulet
Reviews.Content: Customer service was poor during check-in. Digital Camera was stolen from our room during our stay (most likely when we went down for our continental breakfast). Treated with disrespect when we started asking questions about the theft. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you do stay, bring your expensive belongings with you if you leave the room. Over-priced for the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: MsFi
Reviews.Content: Ok....here goes. The rooms are tiny and lots of them are an awkward shape...ie. when i opened my bathroom door it collided with the bed. The shower was a claustrophobic experience and I am glad I am not any bigger as I kept banging my elbows on the shower wall. So it was a quick scrub and out! The breakfast was very ordinary and the lack of any other catering facilities...i.e cafe or room service ...meant that in the middle of winter you had to bundle up and head to a restaurant every night. There are no bar fridges so forget self catering. Lack of laundromat meant another long hike up to the village to do laundry. I think if a hotel is going to be low budget then it should cater for budget travellers with washing facilities and some self catering in the room, especially if no other food service is available. The staff were casual to the pont of rudeness...some very Gallic shrugs. However, on the plus side the location is excellent, the nearest restaurant...chinese....is cheap and delicious and my room had a view of Notre Dame. I had a good visit inspite of the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again!”
Reviews.Author: kissy40
Reviews.Content: I think parking our van was about the easiest and most enjoyable part of our stay at Travelodge Montreal Centre. We did request a room with two twin beds and the bunk beds for an "inexpensive" family trip but this was totally ridiculous! There was no room to actually "sit" on the bottom beds without hitting your heads on the "bunk beds" (which were two single beds attached to the wall, not a bunk bed that I've ever seen in my life. The room was so small we were worried that we wouldn't be able to fit through the door, never mind four of us staying there for two nights comfortably. I will say though, that the shower in the bathroom had good running water. It's just too bad that the drain was about 1hr behind in getting rid of the water. There were no screens in the windows - which isn't necessarily a big deal if you don't have small children with you. The heater/air conditioner kept blowing cold air out, no matter how high we set the temperature. The photo shown on the Travelodge site was NOTHING compared to what we received upon arrival. Breakfast - that's another story altogether. The "french" bread was hard as a rock, the "orange" juice should have been called coloured water. The croissants were stale. The fruit salad was mostly leftovers from the night before it looked. The only decent thing we found to eat was bread (which had been sitting out for who knows how long) that we toasted. Also, having someone watching you constantly while you're eating tends to turn some people off. The ultimate insult was actually watching one of the employees sneeze about three times in his hands and then just wipe his hands on his jeans - THEN continue with putting placemats and cutlery out on the tables. Then, to keep the excitement going, he's clearing his nose as he's walking by those patrons that are eating - totally disgusting if I do say so myself. Overall, never, ever again will our family be staying at this location - totally ruined our vacation and totally ruined my impression of a hotel chain that I'd always heard great things about.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: parishilton101
Reviews.Content: Perhaps Im just used to a little more luxury. Im 6"3 and the room that my wife and i had was very very tiny. It was like one of those Tiny Batchalor Appts you see in Manhattan on TV and you wonder how people actually live in it. The shower is very very small and the soap they provide dries out your skin so you should bring your own. The views ( what views? Its a view of a wall off of some buildings looking at china town). Hey does any website tell you you are in the heart of the red light district when you stay at the Travelodge Montreal ( XXX ). You get to walk out of your hotel and see bums just down the street and all the hookers your heart can desire. The free breakfast is a joke. Its cold cerial and some stale crosionts. I remember them giving me a hard time when i asked for some HOT WATER!. I will be honest that its within walking distance to downtown shopping but you get to walk past lots of homeless people, dirty poor teenagers and lots of XXX. I also had a spider crawling up my wall and i called the Hotel Manager so view the bugs for himself and when he saw it He did NOTHING!!!! Trust me People, Do your homework and stay elsewhere. Its worth the extra 20-30 bucks a night to stay somewhere CLEAN. '

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: aap19
Reviews.Content: After searching for a hotel in downtown Montreal for the weekend, my brother recommended Travelodge. I came onto this website and was reading all the other reviews and couldnt understand why my brother would recommend this hotel when every one else is not recommending it. I trusted him so I booked the hotel for a weekend in June. We arrived about 7pm and check in went very well. There are a two things that I did not know until I arrived and that was parking is 14.95 a night & they need a $50 room deposit. You park right underground of the hotel and there are elevators to take you straight up to your room. We were on a smoking floor but suprisingly it did not smell like cigarettes at all. Our room was a tad bit small, but comfortable for two people. The room was equipped with everything you needed such as coffee maker, wireless internet, AC, & even a LCD television. The bathroom only has a shower stall and no bathtub, so if you need a bathtub then this wouldnt be the place for you. When we arrived our AC did not work, but was fixed within 10 minutes of asking the front desk about it. The gift shop in the hotel can change your money for you, and even when it was closed the front desk had no problem doing it. We had no problems checking out and our car was very safe in the underground parking area. (you can only get into the parking if you had paid for it and you have to slide your room key to open the garage door) The travelodge hotel was located right in downtown montreal, i dont think we could have gotten a hotel in a better location. The next block over is China Town with a lot of neat shops and Ste. Catherins street is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. I would strongly recommend this hotel to travelers who want to be close to everything and be within walking distance to all the bars & shops. The Travelodge is just like a holiday inn or the Quality inn, just a lot cheaper! Im planning on returning to montreal for new years and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but you get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Thepeevs
Reviews.Content: The location was good and the front staff were very helpful and friendly but I would definitely suggest that you go with the two beds room versus the double bed (it was pretty small). The room served our purpose for a two night stay but they have to be the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. You don't even have room to bend over in the shower (there were no shelves in the shower so you had to set everything on the floor and the shower walls had mildew on them. The free breakfast was okay but don't go during the busy time. The staff had a very hard time keeping up and there was no where to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and did what I needed”
Reviews.Author: garthy39
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this site and I was dreading it, but I was relieved on arrival to find a hotel that served the purpose I needed and matched the price I paid. The staff were very helpful and helped with my tax claims. The room was fine and did the job, clean and had evrything a room requires. If your a single traveller etc then yes its for you, if your a family wanting pools, bars, gyms etc then you should know a Travel lodge will not cater for you. Also the candid photos someone else has posted has looked hard for the worst bits, i'll post some for you showing the view from the hotel front which is a true reflection. yes I'd go there again as it served the travelling mans purposes pretty well and it was clean and a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good...”
Reviews.Author: oleiros
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge for 3 nights during the Liberal leadership convention in Montreal. I was afraid it would be a dump, but I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was inviting, the staff weren't overly friendly but were far from rude. The room was smallish, not the cleanest but very good considering the hotel was old. Had a nice view of old Montreal. The hotel is a couple minutes walk from the convention centre and 5 minutes from Place des Armes and Notre Dame in Old Montreal. It was a great hotel, quiet (hardly heard anything from the other rooms) just the vent in the washroom was a bit loud when turned on... That was the only thing I would consider a major disadvantage with the room. Breakfast was good - lots of things to eat, and the dining room was clean with a nice view onto Rene-Levesque Blvd. The neighbourhood was fine - never saw anything dodgy, it's on a major street with government buildings and office towers. Great location, good rooms, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is poor”
Reviews.Author: Xcalibur
Reviews.Content: Customer Service: I had booked 2 non-smoking hotel rooms online. However, on my arrival at 9pm, I was informed that they only had 1 non-smoking and encouraged me to take a smoking room instead. I am an asthmatic and cannot stay in a smoking room.
